messages.message: Found this strange bug where you can’t go from one workspace to another: https://www.loom.com/share/42f6ef6d0a7f4f96992681540826a192?sid=e4d684c6-9bcc-4045-896c-d350b9bea033

Hey Orlando, looks like this isn't a bug but maybe confusing UX. The reason you see a change when you go to your community account is because the _context_ is changing so we don't want to show you the project in the old context anymore. When you go to a different workspace within the same context, we'd show you the list of projects in the workspace but not redirect you a new project. This might be made more confusing by the fact that you don't have any projects in that new workspace to show.

I'm not sure it would be less confusing if we redirected you to a project in the new workspace... what if you're just browsing and want to pick a different one from the list? We could also send you to that blank state you saw when you selected the community context, but we're actually trying to get rid of that state.

cc @Kaustubh (KD)

I agree, it’s likely UX related.
I think generally the Workspace vs myHub vs projects vs apps relationships are not easy to grasp as a first time user.
Have you tried out the new Workspace Revamp yet? Would love to get your feedback on whether that makes it clearer. If you log in on the UAT environment you should see it
no, I’ll try that now
what’s the url for uat?
https://aihub-uat.internal.instabase.com/
that looks better!!
can I be upgraded?
FYI @diana.rodolico - workspaces is changing
@Jessica - actually can I be added to an Enterprise level account
@Orlando I invited you to the commercial org. I'm actually not sure if we have an enterprise org on UAT yet @Xindi Xu?
thank you!
can I be an Admin? I want to be able to create workspaces and show  how this will change to my customer
No, I didn't upgrade our internal orgs to enterprise orgs but you can add yourself to one: https://docs.google.com/document/d/19h-Qb_W8NfXIXcZQLA1vw0TAWCMZukmiXbqAdFxfxo4/edit?usp=sharing
@Orlando I made you an admin - also please feel free to follow the instructions in that doc to make your own org!
thank you!!

Just playing with this now. The first that jumped to mind that I was hoping for in the revamped workspaces: there are still two places to manage workspaces and members. I think this should be consolidated to one
especially as one of them has added functionality (datasrouces) - which could lead to: “oh which one do I need to go to, in order to do that specific thing)
@Orlando I don't want all of this feedback to get lost in this thread, let me talk with PMs and design about the best way to collect this and get back to you!
fair
Will sync with @Jessica and report back on this thread
Okay we have a jira epic to put feedback in!! I'll make a ticket out of that one
